basic.description:
An advanced course on the conception, planning, shooting, and editing of narrative film and television. Working in groups of four, students will produce short, professional quality videos (maximum length eight minutes) for a public screening.
NOTE    Students may enroll in no more than one production course per academic year: FILM 351/3.0; FILM 352/3.0; FILM 353/3.0; FILM 355/6.0; FILM 356/3.0; FILM 365/6.0; FILM 375/6.0; FILM 385/6.0; FILM 410/3.0; FILM 451/3.0; FILM 460/6.0.
LEARNING HOURS    120 (36L;24Lb;24Oc;36P)
basic.subject: FILM
basic.title: Narrative Production

extra.enrollment_requirement:
Prerequisite     A GPA of 2.6 in FILM and (a grade of B- in FILM110 or FILM104&106) and 6.0 units in FILM and registration in a FILM Major or Medial plan, or COCA Spec. or STSC Spec. Plan
Exclusion    No more than 1 course from FILM353; FILM365
